title: Chaitanya Bishnoi, Aaron Jones, Sunny Patel set for Major League Cricket 2024
body:
Chaitanya Bishnoi, Aaron Jones, Sunny Patel set for Major League Cricket 2024

The Domestic Supplementary Draft for Major League Cricket (MLC) took place on June 18, finalizing the rosters for the upcoming second season, set to commence on July 5. Among the domestic players selected was Aaron Jones, the vice-captain of Team USA.

Aaron Jones (PTI Photo)

NEW DELHI: The Domestic Supplementary Draft for Major League Cricket ( MLC ) took place on June 18, finalizing the rosters for the upcoming second season, set to commence on July 5. Among the domestic players selected was Aaron Jones , the vice-captain of Team USA.

With the immense popularity of the T20 World Cup and the success of the American team, three MLC teams--Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, and Seattle Orcas--had an available roster spot, allowing undrafted domestic players the chance to secure a place in the forthcoming tournament.

The supplementary draft order was randomly determined on June 18, and the teams were allotted a 48-hour window to strategize and conclude any internal discussions before proceeding with their picks.

The domestic supplementary draft selections were as follows:

LA Knight Riders - Chaitanya Bishnoi

A top-order batsman and spin bowler, the 29-year-old played for the Chennai Super Kings championship side in 2018 before moving to the United States to pursue his cricket in early 2023. He was a part of the San Francisco Unicorns squad in the 2023 inaugural season of Major League Cricket, featuring in all five matches for the Bay Area side.

He was also a key member of the Dallas Xforia Giants during the 2023 edition of Minor League Cricket.

Seattle Orcas - Aaron Jones

Jones finds himself back in a recognizable locker room, as he was part of the Orcas squad during the first season of Major League Cricket last year. The opening batsman has been instrumental in Team USA's impressive run in the 2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup. Throughout Team USA's unprecedented World Cup journey, Jones has been making waves and was a key player in the USA's remarkable victory against Pakistan in Texas. The Orcas faithful will be eagerly anticipating more of the same from Jones during the MLC season.

MI New York - Sunny Patel

Sunny Patel, a versatile cricketer who bats right-handed in the middle order and bowls leg spin, made a significant impact during the 2023 Minor League Cricket season. His all-round skills were instrumental in propelling the New Jersey Somerset Cavaliers to the Championship match, although they ultimately suffered a defeat against the Dallas Mustangs. As MI New York prepares for the 2024 season, Patel brings a unique dimension to their domestic player contingent. He stands out as the sole domestic leg-spinner on their roster, offering a valuable asset to the team's bowling arsenal.

"Major League Cricket plays a critical role in developing domestic players and providing a pathway to play cricket at the highest level amongst some of the best players in the world. We are thrilled to welcome Chaitanya, Aaron, and Sunny to the 2024 MLC season, adding three more talented domestic players to our league," said Major League Cricket Tournament Director, Justin Geale as per a MLC release.

The highly anticipated second season of MLC is set to kick off on July 5, featuring a thrilling opening match between the defending champions MI New York and the Seattle Orcas at Morrisville, NC. Following this clash, the Texas Super Kings will face off against the LA Knight Riders at Grand Prairie Stadium, TX.

Given the overwhelming success and packed stadiums of the inaugural season, cricket enthusiasts are advised to secure their tickets well in advance to avoid disappointment. Fans can choose from various ticket options, with general admission tickets starting at an affordable price of $30 per person, ensuring accessibility for all.

End of Article

FOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA
summary:
**Major League Cricket 2024 Season**

* The Domestic Supplementary Draft took place on June 18, finalizing the rosters for the upcoming second season, which is set to commence on July 5.
* Three domestic players were selected: Chaitanya Bishnoi (LA Knight Riders), Aaron Jones (Seattle Orcas), and Sunny Patel (MI New York).
* The selected players bring a range of skills, including batting, spin bowling, and leg spin, to their respective teams.
* The second season of MLC will feature a thrilling opening match between MI New York and Seattle Orcas on July 5, followed by a match between Texas Super Kings and LA Knight Riders.
* Tickets for the tournament are now available, with general admission tickets starting at $30 per person.

title: Lexus To Elevate Fan Experience As New Automotive Partner Of Major League Cricket
body:
-Irwin Mills

Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) has announced that Lexus will be the Automotive Partner for its second season. "We are excited to welcome Lexus as the Automotive Partner of Major League Cricket," said Vijay Srinivasan, CEO of MLC. "Their reputation for unparalleled luxury and commitment to their customers aligns perfectly with our vision for the league. Together, we look forward to delivering an exceptional experience to cricket fans across the nation."

Under this new partnership, Lexus will be prominently featured in on-field and broadcast content throughout the season. The brand will also appear in fan communications and on MLC’s digital platforms. This collaboration marks the first time that Lexus and MLC have joined forces.

"Partnering with Major League Cricket offers Lexus the opportunity to reach a new diverse fanbase with a brand that shares an unwavering commitment to performance, customer experience, and their fans," said David Telfer, National Manager of Lexus Advertising and Media. "We’re committed to growing with MLC during its second season to elevate the presence of the U.S. team and engage with new fans."

Lexus is known for its dedication to innovative design, advanced technology, and thrilling performance, which allows it to create remarkable experiences for its customers. Since its inception in 1989 with two luxury sedans, Lexus has expanded its lineup to cater to luxury customers in over 90 countries.

In the United States, Lexus vehicles are sold through 244 dealers offering a full range of luxury vehicles. The brand leads in luxury hybrids with eight models featuring Lexus Hybrid Drive. Additionally, Lexus offers nine F SPORT models, one F performance model, and one F model.

The second season of MLC begins on Friday, July 5. Tickets for all matches, including four playoffs, are available online through the Official Cognizant Major League Cricket website. General admission tickets start at $30 per person.

Fans can expect more than just world-class cricket matches; there will be entertainment, fireworks, free giveaways, player signings and meet-and-greets, merchandise giveaways, food trucks, and samples throughout the tournament.

About Cognizant Major League Cricket

Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) is the first professional Twenty20 cricket championship in the United States. Exclusively sanctioned by USA Cricket, MLC showcases superstar players from around the globe, bringing world-class T20 cricket to America.

MLC’s transformative first season occurred in the summer of 2023 and featured six teams: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom.

This partnership between MLC and Lexus aims to enhance fan engagement while promoting both brands' values of excellence and commitment to their audiences.

**Tournament Details:** The second season of MLC begins on July 5, with tickets available online, starting at $30 per person. The tournament will feature world-class cricket matches, entertainment, fireworks, free giveaways, player signings, and more.

title: Major League Cricket names Lexus as automotive partner ahead of second season
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC), the United States’ professional T20 league, has announced a sponsorship agreement with one of the leading automotive brands, Lexus.

As part of the deal, the brand has become the automotive partner for the league’s highly anticipated second season.

Vijay Srinivasan, CEO of MLC, said, “We are excited to welcome Lexus as the Automotive Partner of Major League Cricket. Their reputation for unparalleled luxury and commitment to their customers aligns perfectly with our vision for the league. Together, we look forward to delivering an exceptional experience to cricket fans across the nation.”

The new deal calls for Lexus to be included in broadcast and on-field content all season long. The brand will also be promoted through fan communications and MLC digital media.

David Telfer, Head of Lexus Advertising & Media, said, “Partnering with Major League Cricket offers Lexus the opportunity to reach a new diverse fanbase with a brand that shares an unwavering commitment to performance, customer experience, and their fans. We’re committed to growing with MLC during its second season to elevate the presence of the U.S. team and engage with new fans.”

Earlier this month, MLC also collaborated with Remitly, a leading digital money transfer service. Additionally, brands such as Cognizant, Royal, and Stake have also partnered with the league for the season ahead.

The second season of MLC is set to begin on July 5. Tickets for all games, which include the four playoffs, can be purchased online via the Major League Cricket website. In addition to world-class competitions, fans enjoy a variety of ticket options, with general admission tickets commencing at $30 per person.

The season’s enthusiasm goes beyond the field, with entertainment, fireworks, free giveaways, athlete signings and meet-and-greets, merchandise giveaways, food trucks, and samples throughout the tournament.
summary:
* Major League Cricket (MLC) has announced a sponsorship deal with Lexus, making the brand its automotive partner for the second season.
* The deal includes Lexus being featured in broadcast and on-field content, fan communications, and MLC digital media throughout the season.
* This is one of several partnerships announced by MLC, including collaborations with Remitly, Cognizant, Royal, and Stake.
* The second season of MLC is set to begin on July 5, with tickets available online starting at $30 per person, featuring world-class competitions and additional entertainment such as fireworks, giveaways, athlete signings, and more.

title: Glenn Maxwell Joins Washington Freedom for Major League Cricket Season
body:
Glenn Maxwell, the newest Australian player to join the Washington Freedom, has confirmed his decision to join the Major League Cricket (MLC) team.

Maxwell's decision to not play for Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the IPL was primarily due to his poor performance, not a need for a mental break.

He will join fellow Australian teammates Head and Smith, and former IPL coach Ricky Ponting at the Washington Freedom.

Other confirmed signings for the second season of MLC include Head, Smith, Adam Zampa, Spencer Johnson, Tim David, Matt Short, and Jake Fraser-McGurk.

Maxwell clarified his decision to request exclusion from RCB's lineup in the recent IPL match against Sunrisers Hyderabad, stating he had a sense of exclusion from the top eleven players.

Royal Challengers Bengaluru all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has decided to take an indefinite “mental and physical” break from the Indian Premier League, blaming his wretched batting form for the decision.

The World Cup-winning Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell planned to play in the Indian Premier League until the end of his career, calling it one of his greatest learning experiences.
summary: Glenn Maxwell, an Australian cricketer, has joined the Washington Freedom team in the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament. He will be joined by fellow Australian teammates Travis Head and Steve Smith, as well as former IPL coach Ricky Ponting. Other confirmed signings for the second season of MLC include Adam Zampa, Spencer Johnson, Tim David, Matt Short, and Jake Fraser-McGurk.

body:
News

Sports News

Cricket News

Major League Cricket: MLC 2024 Full schedule, timings, venue, fixtures, tickets

Major League Cricket: MLC 2024 Full schedule, timings, venue, fixtures, tickets

Australian cricketers Pat Cummins and Jake Fraser-McGurk join the San Francisco Unicorns in the Major League Cricket, enhancing the league's international talent pool.

Major League Cricket

NEW DELHI: Major League Cricket has recently been awarded List-A status by the ICC , officially recognizing it as America's first world-class domestic T20 tournament . This milestone marks a significant development for cricket in the United States.

The league includes six teams: the Los Angeles Knight Riders , MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom. These teams feature some of the best international and domestic cricket talent.

"Now, every century, half-century, 'ﬁve-for', run-out, win, loss, and championship will be documented as official career statistics in an internationally recognised format of the game. This will also provide local US players and upcoming stars of the game the opportunity for international recognition, furthering the development of domestic talent by the MLC," MLC's official release read.

The USA league features several notable cricket players including Ali Khan, Nitish Kumar, and Shadley Van Schalkwyk from Los Angeles Knight Riders, as well as Steven Taylor, Nosthush Kenjige, Monank Patel, and Shayan Jahangir from MI New York. Additionally, Corey Anderson and Haris Rauf represent San Francisco Unicorns, while Harmeet Singh is with Seattle Orcas. Milind Kumar plays for Texas Super Kings, and Andries Gous, Saurabh Netravalkar, and Yasir Mohammad are part of Washington Freedom.

Among the Los Angeles Knight Riders' lineup are players Ali Khan, Nitish Kumar, and Shadley Van Schalkwyk. Representing MI New York are Steven Taylor, Nosthush Kenjige, Monank Patel, and Shayan Jahangir.

Corey Anderson and Haris Rauf are key players for San Francisco Unicorns. Harmeet Singh is associated with Seattle Orcas. Milind Kumar is a notable member of the Texas Super Kings.

Washington Freedom has a lineup that includes Andries Gous, Saurabh Netravalkar, and Yasir Mohammad.

MLC has already revolutionised the cricket landscape in the USA, the release said. "The inaugural 2023 season was a huge success, with sold-out matches garnering millions of viewers worldwide. This set the momentum for the upcoming T20 World Cup and the MLC's second season, which kicks off July 5."

Australia's test and ODI captain Pat Cummins has signed a four-year deal with the San Francisco Unicorns in a major coup for the fledgling Major League Cricket (MLC) T20 competition.

The second season of MLC starts on July 5, less than a week after the T20 World Cup co-hosted by the United States and West Indies wraps up.

Fast bowler Cummins will join hard-hitting compatriot Jake Fraser-McGurk at the Unicorns and follows Australia team mates Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head and Steve Smith into the league.

MLC 2024 Tickets:

MLC kicks off its second season on Friday, July 5, with tickets for all matches, including the four playoffs, available online at tickets.majorleaguecricket.com. Fans have several ticket options, with general admission tickets starting at $30 per person.

In addition to the world-class matches, the excitement extends beyond the pitch. There will be entertainment, fireworks, free giveaways, player signings and meet-and-greets, merchandise giveaways, food trucks, and samples throughout the tournament.

title: LPL 2024 To Introduce New ‘Power Blast Overs’ Rule; Here Are The Full Details
body:
The Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) board has announced the introduction of a new rule in the upcoming Lanka Premier League (LPL 2024), which brings in additional powerplay overs for the batting side.

The LPL 2024 season will span from July 1 to 21, clashing heavily with the Major League Cricket in the United States. The latter will feature more well-known international players; the LPL has generally failed to draw global talent despite the money on offer, but it is popular among local fans.

The tournament’s fifth season, the LPL 2024 will feature 20 league matches between five franchises, followed by three playoffs and a final. Each team will play each other twice during the league stage before four of the five teams advance to the playoffs.

Dambulla Sixers, a new club, is one of the teams. The Dambulla team’s ownership shift was announced earlier this month, after Sri Lanka Cricket was forced to cancel the previous franchise due to one of its co-owners, Tamim Rahman, being arrested by Sri Lanka authorities under the Prevention of Offences Related to Sports Act.

What is the ‘Power Blast Overs’ rule in LPL 2024?

The Lanka Premier League organizers will introduce a new feature dubbed ‘Power Blast Overs’ to add more aggression and excitement to a specific portion of their league. The feature is intended to include a special powerplay in the latter part of both innings.

“The Lanka Premier League 2024 will introduce an exciting new feature with the addition of a special power play towards the latter part of each innings. This innovation, named ‘Power Blast Overs,’ will provide each team with a two-overpower play during the 16th and 17th overs of their innings,” SLC said in a statement.

The newly introduced Power Blast Overs feature will be used in the 16th and 17th overs of each innings. During this phase, a team will be allowed to field only four fielders outside the 30-yard circle, rather than the typical five outside the first six overs.

“This new power play will be in addition to the traditional power play that occurs during the first six overs of an inning. During the ‘Power Blast Overs,’ only four fielders will be allowed outside the circle, thus creating a more aggressive and thrilling phase of the game,” the statement added.

On the new feature, Tournament Director of the LPL 2024 Samantha Dodanwela said, “We decided to bring this innovation in order to create further excitement for the league, which is growing year by year. This new introduction is sure to generate a lot of excitement among the fans, and the teams will need to strategize effectively to make the most of this period.”
summary:
* The Major League Cricket (MLC) in the United States will take place from July 1 to 21, coinciding with the Lanka Premier League (LPL) 2024 season.
* The MLC will feature more well-known international players compared to the LPL.

Note that there is no additional information about the MLC tournament in the article beyond these two points, as the primary focus is on the Lanka Premier League (LPL) 2024.

title: Major League Cricket : MLC 2024 Calendrier complet, horaires, lieu, calendrier, billets
body:
2024-06-27 19:35:07

NEW DELHI : La Major League Cricket a récemment obtenu le statut de liste A par l’ICC, la reconnaissant officiellement comme le premier tournoi national T20 de classe mondiale aux États-Unis. Cette étape marque un développement important pour le cricket aux États-Unis.

La ligue comprend six équipes : les Los Angeles Knight Riders, le MI New York, les San Francisco Unicorns, les Seattle Orcas, les Texas Super Kings et Washington Freedom. Ces équipes comptent certains des meilleurs talents de cricket internationaux et nationaux.

“Désormais, chaque siècle, demi-siècle, “cinq pour”, défaite, victoire, défaite et championnat seront documentés sous forme de statistiques officielles de carrière dans un format de jeu internationalement reconnu. Cela fournira également aux joueurs américains locaux et aux futures stars du jeu l’opportunité d’une reconnaissance internationale, favorisant ainsi le développement des talents nationaux par la MLC”, indique le communiqué officiel de la MLC.

La ligue américaine comprend plusieurs joueurs de cricket notables, dont Ali Khan, Nitish Kumar et Shadley Van Schalkwyk des Los Angeles Knight Riders, ainsi que Steven Taylor, Nosthush Kenjige, Monank Patel et Shayan Jahangir du MI New York. De plus, Corey Anderson et Haris Rauf représentent les Licornes de San Francisco, tandis que Harmeet Singh est avec les Orcas de Seattle. Milind Kumar joue pour les Texas Super Kings et Andries Gous, Saurabh Netravalkar et Yasir Mohammad font partie de Washington Freedom.

Parmi l’alignement des Los Angeles Knight Riders figurent les joueurs Ali Khan, Nitish Kumar et Shadley Van Schalkwyk. Représentant MI New York sont Steven Taylor, Nosthush Kenjige, Monank Patel et Shayan Jahangir.

Corey Anderson et Haris Rauf sont des joueurs clés des Licornes de San Francisco. Harmeet Singh est associé aux orques de Seattle. Milind Kumar est un membre notable des Texas Super Kings.

Washington Freedom a une programmation qui comprend Andries Gous, Saurabh Netravalkar et Yasir Mohammad.

MLC a déjà révolutionné le paysage du cricket aux États-Unis, indique le communiqué. “La saison inaugurale 2023 a été un énorme succès, avec des matchs à guichets fermés attirant des millions de téléspectateurs dans le monde entier. Cela a donné le ton à la prochaine Coupe du monde T20 et à la deuxième saison du MLC, qui débutera le 5 juillet.”

Le test australien et capitaine de l’ODI, Pat Cummins, a signé un contrat de quatre ans avec les Licornes de San Francisco dans le cadre d’un coup majeur pour la toute nouvelle compétition T20 de la Major League Cricket (MLC).

La deuxième saison de MLC débute le 5 juillet, moins d’une semaine après la fin de la Coupe du monde T20 co-organisée par les États-Unis et les Antilles.

Le quilleur rapide Cummins rejoindra son compatriote Jake Fraser-McGurk chez les Unicorns et suivra ses coéquipiers australiens Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head et Steve Smith dans la ligue.

Billets MLC 2024 :

MLC lance sa deuxième saison le vendredi 5 juillet, avec des billets pour tous les matchs, y compris les quatre séries éliminatoires, disponibles en ligne sur billets.majorleaguecricket.comLes fans ont plusieurs options de billets, avec des billets d’entrée générale à partir de 30 $ par personne.

Au-delà des matches de classe mondiale, l’excitation s’étend au-delà du terrain. Il y aura des divertissements, des feux d’artifice, des cadeaux gratuits, des dédicaces et des rencontres de joueurs, des cadeaux de marchandises, des food trucks et des échantillons tout au long du tournoi.

title: Seattle Orcas Ready for Pre-Season Training Camp: Eyes Set on Major league Cricket Season 2 Season
body:

title: Will the ICC T20 World Cup 2024 help cricket finally take off in the US?
body:
Is cricket really coming to the United States?

The game has long desired to conquer the land of dreams, and it won’t get a better shot at finally making it big.

As the United States hosts 16 matches of the latest ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, there are high hopes that cricket can finally make significant inroads in a lucrative and populous market.

The stars have seemingly aligned: Following the T20 World Cup, the second edition of the privately run Major League Cricket franchise tournament will bring some of the game’s biggest stars to the US and, in 2028, cricket will feature at the LA Olympics for the first time since 1900.

However, cricket in the US has a history of poor governance, riven by factions and financial mismanagement. The sport’s growth has been hampered by the country’s sheer size and diversity of cricket cultures – factors also considered potential strengths.

Here’s the lowdown on cricket’s history in the US and a peek into its future:

Is there an existing cricket culture in the USA?

When USA and Canada meet in the opening match on June 1, there will be plentiful reminders that these two countries played the first international cricket match in 1844, when Canada won the two-day fixture.

But the game took a backseat until the latter half of the 20th century when increased immigration – particularly from the Indian subcontinent – saw the game grow – with little cohesion – in communities from India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh as well as the Caribbean.

Does USA have a cricket board?

A national governing board, the United States of America Cricket Association (USACA), was formed in 1965 but it struggled to unify the diverse and siloed cricket communities for the next three decades.

The International Cricket Council (ICC), at times, implemented sanctions – withdrawing USA from tournaments, withholding funds and suspensions – all of which failed to overcome the fundamental issues.

In 2017, the USACA was expelled from the ICC.

So who’s in charge now?

A new governing body, USA Cricket (USAC), was formed in 2019 and the USA was officially back in the ICC’s fold as an associate member. There was a new board and a new constitution, but the underlying problems of geography, culture and power struggles remained.

The following year, after extensive research on potential expansion markets, the ICC identified the USA as the game’s most desirable target. This was largely down to its size, economy, broadcast market and the existing cricket infrastructure and culture.

Who is running the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup?

The decision to host T20 World Cup fixtures in the US was merely the first step in a long-term strategy.

The inclusion of the US in the West Indies’ successful bid to host this year’s tournament presented a golden opportunity to expand the sport’s profile but USA Cricket was in no position to facilitate a major event.

In October 2022, the ICC installed its own local organising committee – T20 USA Inc – to oversee the event.

What’s wrong with USA Cricket?

In the five years since its inception, USA Cricket has had minimal and – at times – no full-time staff. It has instead relied on a mix of temporary contractors, consultants and volunteers.

It has been issued multiple sanctions by the ICC and – in 2022 – its funding was temporarily suspended.

It is currently operating without a CEO.

The selection process for the T20 World Cup squad was mired in controversy and excluded numerous eligible players.

The head coach, former Australian international Stuart Law, wasn’t appointed until mid-April.

How good is USA’s T20 World Cup squad?

On the field, the team has had an encouraging build-up, trouncing Canada 4-0 and defeating Bangladesh 2-1 in bilateral T20 series.

Those results are astonishing considering USA had not played a T20 International since the World Cup qualifiers in July 2022. Since USA Cricket was admitted, the national men’s side has played just seven T20Is outside qualifying events. Since the start of 2022, they have played a total of twelve T20Is. By comparison, Nepal has played 36 in the same period.

Have things improved since the US was announced as the co-host?

The publicly available minutes of USAC board meetings show that off-field conflicts continue to boil over.

In the lead-up to the biggest cricket tournament ever held on US soil, there have been squabbles over the constitution, allegations of racial discrimination and disagreements on the process of choosing a new CEO.

A lawsuit filed by two directors against five fellow directors and a former CEO was dropped in 2022, but in 2023 another lawsuit was filed against USAC by former USA captain and league director Sushil Nadkarni.

At the most recent board meeting on March 27, Chair Venu Pisike “reaffirmed that board members MUST conduct themselves professionally and stop interrupting the board proceedings and being disrespectful to fellow board members”.

How might cricket grow after the T20 World Cup?

Amid concerns about USAC’s governance, the ICC is forging ahead with plans to create a lasting legacy from the T20 World Cup. Profits from the matches held in Nassau County (New York), Broward County (Florida) and Grand Prairie (Texas) will be funnelled into cricket’s growth in the US.

ICC’s game development programme, Playground to Podium, aims to reach one million children – half of them female – by the 2028 LA Olympics, and regional development manager for the Americas, Fara Gorsi, is confident of success.

“By the time we reach the LA Games it will be flourishing in all three cities as a minimum,” Gorsi told Al Jazeera. “And [it] will create a framework that will then be deployed across the states.

“If we want to see a different community grow cricket in the USA it has to come organically through schools, through new leaders, new communities, parents, teachers.”

Gorsi says the complexity of the US sporting system requires a targeted and flexible approach in each district as the ICC rolls out resources, initially in the three host cities, to develop facilitators and coaches via an entry-level training programme called Criiio. There are long-term plans to permeate the college system, a key for any sport in the US.

Is there a way to improve the situation?

The ICC has expressed concerns to USAC and has given them a July deadline to appoint a CEO. They can apply sanctions of varying severity but pressure will also be applied by the US Olympic and Paralympic Committee (USOPC).

To become certified as cricket’s national governing body, USAC will have to meet USOPC’s rigorous criteria and standards.

As for the legacy programme, the ICC has not yet discussed a timeframe or mechanism for any possible future handover of the development programme and its funding to USA Cricket. Gorsi hopes it will eventually happen but admits there are significant barriers to overcome.

“Without wanting to sound disrespectful, they’ve held it on to like it’s their sport,” said Gorsi.

“If we grow it organically we’ll grow faster. We need to take the shackles off and allow it to be fun and have that accessibility across the country.

“Once we break some of those barriers down and allow the US audience to be part of this wonderful game that we all love, I think it will spread like wildfire.”
summary:
* The article does not provide new information about the Major League Cricket (MLC) franchise tournament, but it mentions that the second edition of MLC will bring some of the game's biggest stars to the US after the T20 World Cup.
* There is no additional information about the tournament format, schedule, or participating teams.
* The article primarily focuses on the challenges and opportunities for cricket to grow in the US, highlighting the country's large and diverse cricket cultures, but also the historical governance issues and financial mismanagement that have hindered the sport's growth in the country.

title: An influx of domestic T20 Leagues in USA
body:
In the United States of America, a country where people think of cricket as a version of baseball, it is important to understand if the ICC T20 World Cup would be successful or not.

However, over the past decade, domestic T20 leagues have taken the cricketing world by storm, transforming the sport from a backyard hobby to a global phenomenon.

As such in the US, the shortened and quick version of cricket has been gaining popularity little by little.

Major League Cricket (MLC), the US equivalent of the Indian Premier League (IPL), will launch after the World Cup.

USA Cricket, the ICC's representative organisation for the US, had chosen MLC as its exclusive partner in 2019 to create a professional T20 Cricket League.

In an effort to propel the USA men's and women's teams to the pinnacle of international competition, the MLC currently also offers assistance to both groups.

The MLC has been instrumental in providing the much-needed impetus to take cricketing in this region of the world to new heights. The top tier of domestic T20 cricket in the USA was introduced in 2019 with the MLC.

This has given American cricket players, who are primarily immigrants, a professional platform and high-calibre competition to draw spectators. In 2023, the MLC burst onto the scene, reshaping the American cricket landscape. For the first time, the United States witnessed world-class domestic T20 cricket, captivating audiences with electrifying matches.

But how would the success of MLC be attributed to?

Firstly, the league would unite some of the top cricket players in the world, giving them a platform where they would display their abilities and dazzle spectators with amazing shows. In addition to drawing in an entirely novel generation of cricket fans, this celebrity influence would improve the game's general standard.

Secondly, it is impossible to overstate the commercial attractiveness of the MLC. The league would serve as a fertile field for rich sponsorship agreements, television rights, and product sales. The MLC attracted numerous sponsors and franchises from other T20 leagues around the world in its inaugural season which was held in 2023. After making an impact in the inaugural season in July 2023, the MLC has got tech giant Cognizant as their title sponsor for the 2024 edition.

In 2023, each team's total salary cap was $1.15M for the tournament, putting MLC amongst the elite T20 global leagues in terms of player compensation per match.

Besides, Minor League Cricket is the only nationwide tournament involving the strongest male players playing against each other at the best available facilities, with almost all of the players selected in the 2023 MLC Domestic Player Draft. It is important to mention that the Minor Cricket League was introduced in the United States in 2021 to develop the 'gentleman's game' into more of a popular sport in the country.

This year, immediately following the World Cup, all six of the teams that participated in the MLC's historic debut season will return. Superstars from Afghanistan, Pakistan's Haris Rauf (San Francisco Unicorns), South Africa's Faf du Plessis (Texas Super Kings), Marco Jansen (Washington Freedom), and Quinton de Kock (Seattle Orcas), as well as Sunil Narine (LA Knight Riders) of the West Indies, have already been confirmed to compete.

Bangladesh's Shakib Al Hasan has been signed as well by the LA Knight Riders for the second season of the tournament. The MLC's games will be held in Grand Prairie Stadium, which is close to Dallas, Texas. The 7,200 seats in this recently refurbished cricket-specific stadium exceed the highest international accreditation standards for a grass wicket.

For Americans who love cricket, MLC co-founder Vijay Srinivasan has promised the 'best summer of cricket'.

Being a trailblazer in USA cricket broadcasting, Srinivasan has long questioned why not a single game played on USA soil was shown on his platform. That compelled him to establish the concept of MLC. After everything fell into place, Srinivasan made the decision. In order to develop a rich talent pool of players to support Minor and Major League Cricket in the US, the MLC is developing international-calibre stadiums, establishing elite junior academies, offering top-notch training facilities and creating high-performance paths.

With its six clubs and backing from well-known figures in the USA and Indian corporate worlds, the MLC was considered by observers to have all the makings of a successful league last year. ABC, NBC, CBS, and The New York Times are among the major American news networks that have taken an interest in the MLC. According to the league's statistics, it has 40 million views, 3 million likes, and 3 million comments on social media already.

In conclusion, MLC has transformed cricket in the USA by bringing unprecedented excitement, global appeal, and opportunities for young players. The Major League Cricket and the Minor League Cricket redefined the way the game is played and watched, captivating audiences with their explosive matches and star-studded lineups. As the popularity of MLC continues to soar, the power and significance in shaping the sport's evolution in the USA cannot be underestimated.
summary:
**Introduction of MLC:** The Major League Cricket (MLC), similar to the Indian Premier League (IPL), will launch in the US after the ICC T20 World Cup.

**Background:** MLC was chosen by USA Cricket in 2019 as its exclusive partner to create a professional T20 Cricket League. The top tier of domestic T20 cricket in the USA was introduced in 2019 with the MLC.

**Success Factors:** The success of MLC can be attributed to two main factors: (1) uniting top cricket players, giving them a platform to showcase their skills and attracting new fans, and (2) its commercial attractiveness, with sponsorship agreements, television rights, and product sales.

**Key Facts:**

* The MLC's inaugural season was held in 2023, with a total salary cap of $1.15 million per team.
* The league has attracted sponsors and franchises from around the world, including tech giant Cognizant as its title sponsor for the 2024 edition.
* Minor League Cricket, introduced in 2021, is a nationwide tournament that develops the game in the country.
* All six teams from the inaugural season will return, featuring international stars like Faf du Plessis, Quinton de Kock, and Sunil Narine.
* The MLC's games will be held at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas, a cricket-specific stadium with 7,200 seats.
* The league aims to develop a rich talent pool of players, establishing elite junior academies, and creating high-performance paths.

**Impact:** MLC has transformed cricket in the USA, bringing excitement, global appeal, and opportunities for young players. The league has gained significant attention, with 40 million views, 3 million likes, and 3 million comments on social media.

title: Aaron Finch and Marcus Stoinis in huge US cricket announcement
body:
Former Australian captain Aaron Finch, Marcus Stoinis and Mitchell Marsh have all joined the Major League Cricket (MLC) competition in the US after announcements on draft day. The Aussie trio have become the first Australian cricket stars confirmed to take part in the inaugural tournament starting in the US later in July.

Finch recently confirmed his retirement as both T20 and One-Day International captain of Australia, but will lead the San Francisco Unicorns. He will captain former Aussie teammate Marcus Stoinis at the new franchise.

OH NO: Warner sparks fresh concerns after missing second ODI against India

'PIC OF THE YEAR': Cricket world in disbelief over amazing scenes

'OUTRAGEOUS': Adam Gilchrist in $380m case of mistaken identity

In a huge grab, the Seattle Orcas have signed Mitchell Marsh for their opening season. Marsh has just joined the Australian team on their three game tour of India and has been the star with the bat.

Opening for Australia, Marsh has scored 81 and 66 not out in his two matches against India. And the Orcas will be thrilled to have snared the in-form allrounder.

Western Australian Cameron Gannon has also joined Marsh at the Orcas. The dual Australia/American citizen represented the US in four T20s back in 2019.

A number of other internationals have signed-up for the inaugural season. New Zealanders Corey Anderson and Liam Plunkett have also both joined Finch and Stoinis at the Unicorns.

South African Anrich Nortje signed for the Washington Freedom, while compatriot Quinton de Kock signed for the Orcas. World No.1 T20 bowler Hasaranga Wanindu also signed for the Washington Freedom.

Steve Smith linked with US cricket move

MLC will hold its inaugural season this July, taking part in Texas and North Carolina over a three-week period. The six-team league has been bankrolled by a number of heavyweights in India, with a reported AU$174 million invested by Microsoft boss Satya Nardella and Bollywood legend Shah Rukh Khan.

Last week, Cricket NSW unveiled a partnership with MLC that will see American players come over to play in NSW Premier Cricket, and Aussies go the other way to play in the MLC.

The partnership will see Cricket NSW provide players and coaches to the Washington team, which could reportedly eventually include Steve Smith. The talismanic Aussie batter won't play in the American T20 League this year due to the Ashes, but is reportedly weighing up a move to the States once he finishes his Test career.

Smith has a second home in New York and a connection to the Big Apple. He popped the question to wife Dani during a holiday there in 2017.
summary:
**Players Joining MLC:**

* Aaron Finch (former Australian captain) will lead the San Francisco Unicorns
* Marcus Stoinis will play for the San Francisco Unicorns
* Mitchell Marsh has signed with the Seattle Orcas
* Cameron Gannon (dual Australia/American citizen) has joined the Seattle Orcas
* Corey Anderson and Liam Plunkett have signed with the San Francisco Unicorns
* Anrich Nortje has signed with the Washington Freedom
* Quinton de Kock has signed with the Seattle Orcas
* Hasaranga Wanindu has signed with the Washington Freedom

**Tournament Details:**

* The inaugural MLC season will take place in July
* The six-team league will be played in Texas and North Carolina over a three-week period
* The league has received investments from Microsoft boss Satya Nardella and Bollywood legend Shah Rukh Khan

**Partnership with Cricket NSW:**

* Cricket NSW has partnered with MLC to exchange players and coaches between the two organizations
* American players will come to play in NSW Premier Cricket, while Australians will play in the MLC
* The partnership may eventually include Steve Smith, who is reportedly considering a move to the States once he finishes his Test career

title: Never thought we'd be playing cricket in any form in US: Virat Kohli labels T20 WC 'start of a domino effect'
body:
The ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024 in the United States of America is a big leap for the sport in a country where cricket doesn't have that level of popularity. USA is the co-host for one of the biggest sporting events in the world along with the Caribbean and it will also be a test of the International Cricket Council (ICC) trying to take the game deeper into the markets where cricket is not the first sport. The first big step from the ICC was to sanction a T20 League (Major League Cricket) and then make USA the co-hosts of the T20 World Cup and then build a modular stadium in New York to get the American public closer to the action.

With T20 World Cup, the second season of the MLC and a new Legends League (Legends Intercontinental T20 League) scheduled to be held in the USA, there is a systematic plan to slowly get the American public introduced to the sport. How long it will take for them to get used to... is everybody's guess but many cricketers, former and current, believe that it is a step in the right direction keeping the sport's qualification into the Olympics in mind, which will be played in Los Angeles.

Virat Kohli, one of the biggest crowd pullers in the game currently, suggested that the T20 World Cup might be the star of the domino effect of what's to come in the future for the sport in the country. Kohli, who visited US Consulate in Mumbai before leaving for the tournament, said that he never thought cricket will get to USA in any format, but here we are.

“Honestly, I never thought we would be playing cricket in any form in the States. But now it’s a reality. And that tells you about the growing impact of the sport in the world and the United States is more than willing to accept the change and be probably the first ones on a global scale to accept it, in a way, with the World Cup," Kohli said in a video shared by US Consulate.

“I think it’s a great start. It’s the ideal way to begin and it’s going to have a huge impact, and in starting off a kind of a domino effect. I hope it carries on for a long period of time,” he added.

“We have enough people from our regions to keep the game up and alive in the States and make the others more aware about what it feels like to play and watch cricket. And I think it’s got great potential, with the MLC as well. There is already franchise cricket happening there. So I think, it’s moving in the right direction,” Kohli further said.
summary:
* The ICC has sanctioned a T20 League, called Major League Cricket (MLC), as part of its plan to increase the popularity of cricket in the United States.
* The MLC is seen as a step in the right direction, along with the T20 World Cup, to introduce cricket to the American public.
* The second season of the MLC is scheduled to be held in the USA, alongside the Legends League (Legends Intercontinental T20 League) and the T20 World Cup.
* Virat Kohli, a prominent cricketer, believes that the T20 World Cup will have a huge impact and start a "domino effect" for cricket in the USA, and that the MLC has great potential to grow the sport in the country.

title: USA women's T20 franchise tournament with world's best players could launch in near future
body:
A new women's T20 franchise tournament in the United States featuring the world's best players could be launched in the near future.

BBC Sport understands preliminary talks have taken place involving stakeholders in the US over its feasibility.

The inaugural season of Major League Cricket (MLC), a men's T20 tournament in the US, took place in 2023.

Discussions are said to be at a very early stage and no specific time frame has yet been established.

The US is preparing to co-host the men's T20 World Cup with the West Indies and the opening match will be played in Dallas on Sunday at 01:30 BST.

Cricket is also set to feature at the 2028 Olympic Games in Los Angeles, and influential figures in American cricket feel there is a unique window to grow domestic interest in the women's game.

The US women's national cricket team - who have never featured at a major International Cricket Council (ICC) event - are likely to qualify for the Olympic tournament as the host nation.

A number of franchise owners in MLC are understood to be open to the prospect of developing a women's team alongside their existing men's sides.
summary: A new women's T20 franchise tournament in the US is being considered, with preliminary talks underway to discuss its feasibility. This comes after the successful inaugural season of the men's Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament in 2023. While no timeline has been set, the discussions are seen as an opportunity to grow interest in the women's game in the US, particularly with cricket being included in the 2028 LA Olympics and the US women's national team likely to qualify for the Olympic tournament as the host nation. Some MLC franchise owners have expressed interest in developing women's teams alongside their existing men's sides.

title: USA vs CAN, T20 World Cup 2024: Grand Prairie Stadium Pitch Report, Dallas Weather Forecast, T20 Stats & Records | USA vs Canada
body:
The T20 World Cup 2024 will commence in Dallas with a match between long-time rivals, the USA and Canada. In April, the USA decisively defeated Canada 4-0 in Houston. The home team might have an advantage due to crowd support, with players like Corey Anderson and Ali Khan having experience in larger venues. Additionally, the rest of the American squad is expected to benefit from playing a season of Major League Cricket in front of packed audiences in Dallas.

Canada, on the other hand, has had more time on the Dallas pitch leading up to the World Cup. They secured a convincing victory in their first warm-up game against Nepal before a hurricane interrupted, canceling their final warm-up match and both of the USA’s scheduled warm-up games.

T20I Stats and Records at Grand Prairie Stadium

So far no international T20I match has taken place at this venue. In the T20 World Cup, this ground is set to host as many as four fixtures.

USA vs CAN: Grand Prairie Stadium Pitch Report:

Grand Prairie Stadium has not hosted any international matches yet, but it served as one of the two locations for Major League Cricket (MLC) in 2023. Out of the 12 MLC games played here, teams surpassed 175 runs on seven occasions and exceeded 200 runs twice, indicating a favorable batting surface. The average score for the first innings is 167, compared to 144 for the second innings. Teams batting first won eight of the 12 matches, while those chasing emerged victorious in four.

Texas Weather Forecast:

The weather forecast for Texas shows a 15% chance of precipitation. The skies will be cloudy, with temperatures around 27 degrees Celsius and humidity levels reaching up to 81%. Additionally, wind speeds are expected to be up to 14 km/h.

USA vs CAN: Probable Playing XI

USA: Monank Patel (c & wk), Aaron Jones, Steven Taylor, Nitish Kumar, Corey Anderson, Jasdeep Singh, Ali Khan, Saurabh Netravalkar, Harmeet Singh, Andries Gous, Nostush Kenjige

Canada: Navneet Dhaliwal, Aaron Johnson, Pargat Singh, Shreyas Movva (wk), Ravinderpal Singh, Nicholas Kirton, Saad Bin Zafar (c), Kaleem Sana, Nikhil Dutta, Dilon Heyliger, Jeremy Gordon
summary:
* The article does not provide a comprehensive overview of the Major League Cricket tournament, but rather focuses on a upcoming match between the USA and Canada in the T20 World Cup 2024.
* However, it does mention that the Grand Prairie Stadium, which will host the match, was one of the two locations for Major League Cricket (MLC) in 2023.
* In the 12 MLC games played at Grand Prairie Stadium, teams surpassed 175 runs on seven occasions and exceeded 200 runs twice, indicating a favorable batting surface.
* The average score for the first innings is 167, compared to 144 for the second innings, and teams batting first won eight of the 12 matches.

Note that the article does not provide a broader summary of the Major League Cricket tournament, its format, teams, or schedule, as it is primarily focused on the upcoming T20 World Cup 2024 match.

title: T20 World Cup 2024: USA vs Canada T20 WC opener canceled? USA Cricket's hilarious media release error causes confusion
body:
United States of America (USA) Cricket has made a huge mistake before the start of the much-awaited T20 World Cup 2024, which is set to be played from June 1 to June 29. The United States of America didn't mention the match between the USA and Canada as the inaugural game of the upcoming T20 World Cup.

Cricket's popularity has been gradually increasing in the United States of America over the past few years. Major League Cricket (MLC), a professional T20 league, commenced last year in the country. The franchise cricket league attracted cricketers from international teams, starting a new era for cricket in the country.

Lauderhill, Florida, New York, and Dallas will host the World Cup matches in the United States. Dallas and Lauderhill will each host four matches in the ICC event. The Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York will host eight matches, including the much-anticipated India-Pakistan match on June 9.

On June 3rd, this venue will host the inaugural game of the 2024 T20 World Cup between Sri Lanka and South Africa - USA Cricket

The USA Cricket Board mistakenly announced Sri Lanka-South Africa as the inaugural match of the 2024 T20 World Cup instead of the USA-Canada match. The board stated that co-hosting the World Cup signifies a new hope for cricket in the United States.

"The Nassau County International Cricket Stadium was unveiled May 15th, marking it as a historical moment in USA Cricket history. On June 3rd, this venue will host the inaugural game of the 2024 T20 World Cup between Sri Lanka and South Africa. USA co-hosting this prestigious ICC event heralds a new hope for cricket in the states," the statement read.

The T20 World Cup will begin with the host nations playing their opening matches in early June. The USA will take on Canada in the tournament opener at the Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium in Dallas on Saturday, June 1. The West Indies will face Papua New Guinea at the Guyana National Stadium on June 2.

The top two teams from the four groups will advance to the Super Eight stages of the tournament. The United States of America will not host any matches in the Super Eight and knockout matches, including the semi-finals and the final. The Kensington Oval in Barbados will host the summit clash on Saturday, June 29.

The Sport's Popularity Decline Due To The World Wars - USA

The statement highlighted the historical relationship between cricket and the USA. The USA board noted cricket's presence in the US since the 18th century but acknowledged its decline due to factors like world wars and societal changes.

"Cricket and the USA have had a long-standing friendship without either party fully committing to a formal union. The ardor and fervor in this connection mirrored the climate in many regions of the country, which was frigid during the winter and scorching during the summer. The history of cricket in the United States can be traced back to the 18th century. However, the sport’s popularity declined due to the world wars and other civil upheavals," the statement further added.
summary:
* Major League Cricket (MLC) is a professional T20 league that commenced last year in the United States, attracting international cricketers and starting a new era for cricket in the country.

Note that there is no further information about the MLC tournament in the provided article, as the main focus is on the 2024 T20 World Cup and the history of cricket in the United States.

title: 45 Major League Cricket Stars Ready To Shine In T20 World Cup
body:
As anticipation builds for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024, Major League Cricket (MLC) is making a significant impact on the international stage. The league will see forty-five of its talented players take part in the ICC’s esteemed tournament, scheduled to run from June 1 to 29, 2024.

This event will be hosted across various venues in the USA and the West Indies, highlighting the global reach and influence of MLC in the cricketing world. In a notable advancement, the ICC has officially granted Cognizant Major League Cricket List-A status, recognizing it as an official 120 league.

This acknowledgment positions MLC as the inaugural high-quality domestic cricket tournament in the United States. The six teams in MLC—Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom—boast a blend of top-tier international and domestic players.

These players are preparing to represent their national teams in the upcoming World Cup, where they will showcase their skills on the global stage.

Team USA includes MLC players Ali Khan, Nitish Kumar, and Shadley Van Schalkwyk (Los Angeles Knight Riders), Corey Anderson (San Francisco Unicorns), Monank Patel and Shayan Jahangir (MI New York), Harmeet Singh, (Seattle Orcas), Milind Kumar (Texas Super Kings) Andries Gous, Steven Taylor, Nosthush Kenjige, Saurabh Netravalkar and Yasir Mohammad (Washington Freedom).

title: NIFTY, Intraday Tips, NSE, News, Mutual Fund, Commodity, Currency, World Market, Finance, Economic, BSE, Wealth, NPS, IPO, Portfolio, MCX, Investment Guru
body:
America's Major League Cricket has announced that they have secured 120 million dollars in funding from series A and A1 fundraising round, which includes some of the Silicon Valley bigwigs like Satya Nadella.

According to MLC, the six-team franchise T20 competition sanctioned by USA Cricket, 44 million dollars has been secured after the closure of these investment rounds and an additional 76 million dollars will be secured over the next 12 months.

The Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella-led group has invested 16 million dollars in the central equity pool of the MLC enterprise along with Dallas-based Ross Perot Jnr, a Texas billionaire, and his partner Anurag Jain.

It has been learnt that the Nadella group will obtain the rights to operate the Seattle franchise of the MLC while the Perot-led consortium will operate the Dallas MLC franchise, a Cricbuzz report said.

The list of other investors includes -- Anand Rajaraman and Venky Harinarayan (Founding Partners at Milliways Ventures and Rocketship VC), Sanjay Govil (Founder and Chairman of Infinite Computer Solutions and CEO, Zyter), The Baheti Family (owners of YASH Technologies) and Tanweer Ahmed (CEO, PAK Foods, CEO, OUR Energy). Ahmed is also the owner of America's largest cricket complex (Prairie View Cricket Complex) located on the outskirts of Houston, housing five turf-wicket grounds on its premises.

The closure of these investment rounds is a major shot in the arm for this cricket 'start-up'. As part of their deal with USA Cricket, MLC is under obligation to deliver six world-class cricket stadiums. Notably, MLC is under exclusive negotiating agreements with respective city governments in the greater Seattle, Los Angeles, and San Francisco Bay area to construct multi-million-dollar cricket stadiums.

The procurement of funds in rounds A and A1 will add to the enterprise's financial muscle to materialise the deals presently under negotiations. MLC has already entered into a long-term lease for Airhogs Stadium near Dallas and is expected to start revamping the stadium for cricketing use this summer.

"The significant funding committed by an outstanding group of investors will allow Major League Cricket to build first-class facilities and accelerate the sport's development across the country, bringing world-class professional cricket to the world's largest sports market," said Sameer Mehta and Vijay Srinivasan, co-founders, Major League Cricket in a statement.

"This investor group comprises leading business executives and successful tech entrepreneurs who have led some of the world's most prominent companies. They bring tremendous experience and expertise in support of MLC's plans to launch a transformative Twenty20 league and establish America as one of the world's leading homes for international cricket events," he added.
